Chapter on the Mother of the Buddha
The Buddha said:
SubhÅ«ti!

It is like a woman who gives birth to many children, perhaps five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, or even a hundred or a thousand. If the mother becomes ill, the children will each diligently seek medical treatment, thinking:
'How can our mother become free from illness, live a long life, be happy, have no physical suffering, and have a peaceful mind?'

At that time, the children will each employ skillful means to seek comfortable living conditions to protect their mother's body, not allowing her to be harmed by mosquitoes, gadflies, snakes, scorpions, cold, heat, hunger, thirst, and other irritants. They will also respectfully make offerings to her with various excellent and wonderful things, saying:
'Our mother is compassionate, gave birth to us, and taught us various worldly affairs. How could we not repay our mother's kindness?'
